title: Now that the VGU voting is over... How long until the results are announced?
body:
For Tristana skin's winner, it took 2 weeks. I am just asking it in the name of all players being curious about the results. 


{{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}

replies.body: We haven't pegged down the exact date, but it should be sometime shortly after MSI is over

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=WEvzsH58,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2019-05-15T19:44:18.726+0000)
>
> We haven't pegged down the exact date, but it should be sometime shortly after MSI is over

Why do these take so long? It's a vote? It should just be announced literally right after the voting is done. Makes it seem like it's not an actual vote and y'all just say it's a vote and then decide yourself.
They have to look at all of the regions, tally those votes together... make a reveal post (have that approved), ect. There's quite a bit they do that goes into these.
LOL? A simple pre-automated system could do that by itself (except for the reveal post), but whatever, just a question of conditionals.

A pre automated system is not worth coding just for this one community vote. Sure we've voted on a two skins in the past but its never been certain that Riot plans to do votes consistently. Its always been a "we don't intend to do this again but it might happen" so there hasn't been a good reason to set up a system in the first place.

Automated system or not, adding together votes is not some multi day thing. I don't care that it takes while but saying adding together votes takes times is ludicrous. It'll take like 30 minutes tops. Making a reveal post, getting it edited and then approved? That is what takes time.
I agree with that. I suspect its a lack of priority and also a demand for other things with more priority deadlines.

That is the essence of having an automated system: It is always worth it because you will be able to plan many other events (with a lot more frequency) while having little to no work since you have already done it. I know it is not easy to create it, you can't just snap your fingers and have it right in front of you, specially a generic one (for n quantity of skins/champions); but I think they have more than enough resources to make it happen. And they would not regret it. 

I mean ... they did make a skin for Ivern ... I think anything's possible at this point.

We want to make sure the blog gets room and attention in the Client, which will be hard during MSI with all the MSI content going into the client during this time. We also have to get the data back from all the regions, see who won, write a blog about it, do feedback and iteration on the blog and then localize it for all regions. I'm hoping we can also maybe get a little more detail into our goals for the winning Champion and maybe even a little early concept art if possible, though it might be tight

Just curious if it's a straight "1 for 1 vote this champion got the most" or if there was any "handicaps" for the less popular of the group. 

It's no secret Nocturne and Fiddle had a huge advantage at the start simply due to popularity, and Shyvana and Voli are not even contestable. Mundo may have had a chance without help, but were any of those factors taken into consideration? Or was it a raw poll?
We will not be doing any handicaps, no.

Okay. Thanks
https://imgur.com/5xvKs98
I might have missed it in the Champion roadmap, but will we get to vote again on the next next VGU?  I never even realized the Vote happened and was hopping there would be another in the future.
We might get to vote again, but not on every VGU.
